initial_story: bias triangles represent features in stability diagrams of quantum dot (qd)devices, whose occurrence and property analysis are crucial indicators for spinphysics. nevertheless, challenges associated with quality and availability ofdata as well as the subtlety of physical phenomena of interest have hindered anautomatic and bespoke analysis framework, often still relying (in part) onhuman labelling and verification. we introduce a feature extraction frameworkfor bias triangles, built from unsupervised, segmentation-based computer visionmethods, which facilitates the direct identification and quantification ofphysical properties of the former. thereby, the need for human input or largetraining datasets to inform supervised learning approaches is circumvented,while additionally enabling the automation of pixelwise shape and featurelabeling. in particular, we demonstrate that pauli spin blockade (psb)detection can be conducted effectively, efficiently and without any trainingdata as a direct result of this approach.

we introduce a feature extraction framework for bias triangles, built from unsupervised, segmentation-based computer vision methods, which facilitates the direct identification and quantification of physical properties of the former.

thereby, the need for human input or large training datasets to inform supervised learning approaches is circumvented, while additionally enabling the automation of pixelwise shape and feature labeling.

in particular, we demonstrate that pauli spin blockade (psb) detection can be conducted effectively, efficiently and without any training data as a direct result of this approach.

furthermore, we have shown that psb detection can be conducted effectively, efficiently and without any training data as a direct result of this approach.

we introduce a feature extraction framework for bias triangles, built from unsupervised, segmentation-based computer vision methods, which facilitates the direct identification and quantification of physical properties of the former.

thereby, the need for human input or large training datasets to inform supervised learning approaches is circumvented, while additionally enabling the automation of pixelwise shape and feature labeling.

in particular, we demonstrate that pauli spin blockade (psb) detection can be conducted effectively, efficiently and without any training data as a direct result of this approach.

we introduce a feature extraction framework for bias triangles, built from unsupervised, segmentation-based computer vision methods, which facilitates the direct identification and quantification of physical properties of the former.

thereby, the need for human input or large training datasets to inform supervised learning approaches is circumvented, while additionally enabling the automation of pixelwise shape and feature labeling.

in particular, we demonstrate that pauli spin blockade (psb) detection can be conducted effectively, efficiently and without any training data as a direct result of this approach.

in particular, we demonstrate that pauli spin blockade (psb) detection can be conducted effectively, efficiently and without any training data as a direct result of this approach.

But there was a problem - the gates were closed, and a voice from inside told him that he could not enter unless he proved his worth.

John was determined to enter Utopia, so he set out to complete a series of challenges. He climbed a tall mountain, swam through a treacherous river, and even battled a dragon. After each challenge, he grew stronger and more determined.

Finally, after weeks of challenges, John arrived back at the gates of Utopia. The voice from inside said, "You have proven your worth, John. Welcome to Utopia."

Inside the gates, John was greeted by a beautiful land filled with lush forests, crystal clear rivers, and majestic mountains. The people of Utopia were kind and welcoming, and they taught John about their way of life.

John stayed in Utopia for many years, learning about the secrets of the land and the wisdom of its people. He became a wise and respected leader, and he helped to bring peace and prosperity to the land.

But eventually, John knew that it was time to leave Utopia and return to his own world. He said goodbye to his friends and set out on the long journey home.

When he arrived back in his own world, John was shocked by the chaos and conflict that he saw around him. He realized that he had been given a special gift - the knowledge of how to create a better world.

John began to spread his message of peace and harmony, and slowly but surely, people began to listen. He traveled the world, sharing his experiences and teaching others about the secrets of Utopia.

As more and more people began to follow his teachings, the world began to change. Conflict and chaos gave way to peace and harmony, and a new age of enlightenment began.

John lived a long and happy life, and when he finally passed away, his legacy lived on. His teachings had transformed the world, and the people of Utopia would never be forgotten.

However, one day John realized that his journey was not yet over. He still had one more challenge to face.

John had to travel to the center of the earth and confront the ancient dragon that guarded the secrets of Utopia. The dragon had been there for centuries, protecting the secrets of the land from outsiders.

John set out on his journey, braving the treacherous terrain and facing countless obstacles along the way. Finally, he reached the dragon's lair and confronted the ancient beast.

The dragon was powerful and cunning, but John was determined to succeed. He used his knowledge of the secrets of Utopia to defeat the dragon and claim the secrets for himself.

With the secrets of Utopia in his possession, John returned to his world and used them to create a better, more harmonious world. He became a legend, and his story was told for generations to come.

But little did John know, his journey was far from over. He had yet to face the greatest challenge of all - the challenge of finding true happiness and fulfillment in his own life.

John had always been a seeker, searching for something greater than himself. He had traveled the world, seeking out adventure and knowledge, but he had never found what he was truly looking for.

Now, as he stood at the top of the world, gazing out at the vast expanse of land and sea before him, he realized that he was still searching. He had found Utopia, but he had not found happiness.

Determined to find true fulfillment, John set out once again on a journey. This time, his journey would take him deep within himself, to the very core of his being.

He faced his fears and his doubts, confronting the demons that had haunted him for so long. He learned to forgive himself and to love himself, and he finally found the peace and contentment that he had been seeking all along.

John returned to Utopia once again, but this time, he brought with him the greatest treasure of all - the knowledge that true happiness comes from within. He shared his wisdom with the people of Utopia, and together, they created a new world, a world where everyone was free to be themselves and to live their own lives in peace and harmony.

And so, John's journey came to an end. But his legacy lived on, inspiring generations to come to seek out their own truth and to create a better world for themselves and for those around them.

# It was a dark and stormy night when the small band of adventurers set out on their quest. With only a vague idea of where they were going and a map that was more of a suggestion than anything else, they set off into the unknown, hoping to find adventure and glory.

# The journey was long and arduous, with many obstacles in their way. They had to traverse treacherous mountains, navigate treacherous forests, and even cross a raging river. But the hardships only served to make them stronger and more determined to reach their goal.

# After many days of travel, they finally reached their destination. A towering castle, shrouded in darkness and surrounded by a dense forest. It was a foreboding sight, but the adventurers were not deterred. They pushed on, determined to reach their goal.

# As they approached the castle, they were met by a strange creature. A creature that seemed to be part human, part animal, and part something else entirely. It was a guardian of the castle, and it was not happy to see them.

# The guardian challenged the adventurers, demanding that they prove their worth before they could enter the castle. The adventurers were prepared, and they were able to defeat the guardian with their skills and determination.

# With the guardian defeated, the adventurers were able to enter the castle. What they found inside was beyond their wildest dreams. Treasures beyond measure, ancient artifacts, and secrets that had been lost to time.

# The adventurers spent many days exploring the castle, uncovering its secrets and discovering its treasures. They were able to find the thing they had been searching for, the thing that had brought them on this journey in the first place.

# With their goal accomplished, the adventurers set out to return home. They were changed by their journey, their experiences, and the things they had learned. They were now more than just a band of adventurers, they were now a family.
